sentences.english: The professor lambasted me for my careless mistake.
sentences.chinese: 教授嚴厲批評了我的粗心錯誤。

sentences.english: He always makes careless mistakes, and he's a pain to work with.
sentences.chinese: 他總犯粗心的錯誤，跟他一起工怍真是痛苦。

sentences.english: That boy is so careless that his books are dog-eared.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩真粗心，他的書本都已經摺角了。

sentences.english: While walking the dog, you were careless and it got loose.
sentences.chinese: 在遛狗的時候，你一粗心鬆開了手中的狗鏈。

sentences.english: Carelessness deserves the blame for many accidents.
sentences.chinese: 許多事故歸咎於粗心大意。

sentences.english: The typist received an admonition from the supervisor for being careless.
sentences.chinese: 那個打字員因粗心大意受到監督人的訓誡。

sentences.english: The boy is really careless, whoes books are folded.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩真粗心，他的書都折角了。

sentences.english: Do you often make careless mistakes?
The character was obviously wrong but he didn't pick it out. It shows how careless he was.
sentences.chinese: 這麼明顯的錯字他都沒看出來，可見他很粗心。

sentences.english: Youare making yourself more passive, unreflective, person, the more TV youwatch.
sentences.chinese: 看得電視越多，你就越將自己變成被動，粗心的人。

sentences.english: This is the kind of careless mistake on which examiners love to pounce.
sentences.chinese: 這是一種主考人喜歡抓住的粗心錯誤。

sentences.english: No one can deny that the accident was caused by care¬lessness.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人能夠否認這起事故是由粗心造成的。

sentences.english: Due to my carelessness, I missed the point of the teacher's lesson.
sentences.chinese: 由於我的粗心，我沒有林會老師上課的要點。

sentences.english: I'm awfully sorry for my carelessness.
sentences.chinese: 對付我的粗心大意我非常歉仄。

sentences.english: Take care not to crumple your dress by packing it carelessly.
sentences.chinese: 當心不要因收放粗心壓縱你的衣服。

sentences.english: This accident was caused by the negligence of a nurse.
sentences.chinese: 這次事故是由一個護士的粗心大意造成的。

definition: a careless person/scatterbrain/frivolous and forgetful/abbr. for 馬馬虎虎、大大咧咧、嘻嘻哈哈|马马虎虎、大大咧咧、嘻嘻哈哈
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
to err/to dial a wrong number/to make a typo
